html: When cleaning up after #Florence, keep in mind some tips for dealing with debris: -Place debris by the curb but do not block the road. -Separate everything into categories, such as household garbage & construction debris. -Keep debris away from trees, poles, or other structures.pic.twitter.com/mg3Ne9dzR2
text:
When cleaning up after #Florence, keep in mind some tips for dealing with debris:
-Place debris by the curb but do not block the road.
-Separate everything into categories, such as household garbage & construction debris.
-Keep debris away from trees, poles, or other structures.pic.twitter.com/mg3Ne9dzR2

html: (2/2) •File your insurance claims now. Don’t wait until you get home to start filing your claims. •FEMA teams are on the ground now to assist survivors in the recovery process. •Before you start cleaning, take photos. It’s important to document damage.
text:
(2/2) •File your insurance claims now.  Don’t wait until you get home to start filing your claims. 
•FEMA teams are on the ground now to assist survivors in the recovery process.  
•Before you start cleaning, take photos.  It’s important to document damage.

html: (1/2) Another set of reminders from @fema: •Avoid exposure to mold/bacteria. Mold & bacteria growth after flood waters recede can be hazardous to your health •Know when it’s safe to return home. Follow instructions of local & state officials so you know when an area is safe
text:
(1/2) Another set of reminders from @fema: 
•Avoid exposure to mold/bacteria.  Mold & bacteria growth after flood waters recede can be hazardous to your health
•Know when it’s safe to return home. Follow instructions of local & state officials so you know when an area is safe

html: Large populations of mosquitoes can emerge after heavy flooding. Most are nuisance mosquitoes, but some can carry viruses/cause illnesses To protect yourself: •Wear long-sleeved shirts/long pants while outdoors. •Use mosquito repellent that contains DEET when outside.
text:
Large populations of mosquitoes can emerge after heavy flooding. Most are nuisance mosquitoes, but some can carry viruses/cause illnesses  To protect yourself: 
•Wear long-sleeved shirts/long pants while outdoors. 
•Use mosquito repellent that contains DEET when outside.

text: #Florence is expected to cause widespread power outages.  Use flashlights instead of candles, if possible. And NEVER use a generator inside your home or garage. html: #FlorenceNC safety tips: - STAY INDOORS. Do not venture out during the storm. - Do NOT drive or walk through stagnant or moving floodwaters. - If your power goes out, do NOT operate gas powered generators or charcoal grills in or near your home. - Have your emergency kit ready!
text:
#FlorenceNC safety tips:
- STAY INDOORS. Do not venture out during the storm.
- Do NOT drive or walk through stagnant or moving floodwaters. 
- If your power goes out, do NOT operate gas powered generators or charcoal grills in or near your home.
- Have your emergency kit ready!

html: (2/2) Ocracoke to Cedar Island: Today: 4pm & 9pm Ocracoke to Swan Quarter: Today: 3:45pm Tomorrow: 7am 7:30 am & 9:30am As of 2 pm this afternoon, the North Carolina Ferry System had evacuated 1,582 people from Ocracoke on the Hatteras, Cedar Island and Swan Quarter routes.
text:
(2/2) Ocracoke to Cedar Island:
Today: 4pm & 9pm 
Ocracoke to Swan Quarter:
Today: 3:45pm
Tomorrow: 7am 7:30 am & 9:30am 
As of 2 pm this afternoon, the North Carolina Ferry System had evacuated 1,582 people from Ocracoke on the Hatteras, Cedar Island and Swan Quarter routes.

html: Prepare your home before a hurricane arrives: Fill your car up with gas. Bring outdoor furniture in and secure items outside. text:
Prepare your home before a hurricane arrives: 
 Fill your car up with gas.
 Bring outdoor furniture in and secure items outside.
 Place personal papers in a waterproof container on the highest level of your home.
More info: http://Ready.gov/hurricanes 
#Florence #Olivia #Isaacpic.twitter.com/Yg37MkQchb

html: (2/3) That's why I was proud this month to join my colleagues @RepDeSantis & @RepTedBudd in sending a letter to House leadership, stating our opposition to earmarks. I also also cosponsored H.R. 5369, the Earmark Elimination Act.
text: (2/3) That's why I was proud this month to join my colleagues @RepDeSantis & @RepTedBudd in sending a letter to House leadership, stating our opposition to earmarks. I also also cosponsored H.R. 5369, the Earmark Elimination Act.

html: (1/3) I’ve said this before and I will say it again – nothing will fill the swamp quicker than the return of earmarks. It is astonishing to me that this is even being considered. I have seen with my own eyes the corruption and fiscal irresponsibility wrought by earmarks.

html: Buying inexpensive food at the risk of endangering our children is NEVER an option. That's why my colleagues and I are once again urging appropriators to include language in FY2019 to ensure that Chinese-processed poultry is not used in school food. https://jones.house.gov/press-release/jones-opposes-chinese-chicken-us-schools …
text:
Buying inexpensive food at the risk of endangering our children is NEVER an option. That's why my colleagues and I are once again urging appropriators to include language in FY2019 to ensure that Chinese-processed poultry is not used in school food. 

https://jones.house.gov/press-release/jones-opposes-chinese-chicken-us-schools …
